summary: Email correspondence between federal prosecutors and defense attorney Suzanne Jaffe Bloom regarding scheduling a meeting for a client who received a grand jury subpoena in the SDNY Epstein investigation. The email discusses postponing the grand jury appearance date and provides information about related civil cases.

persons.name: Suzanne Jaffe Bloom
persons.context: Partner at Winston & Strawn LLP, representing a client who received a grand jury subpoena in the SDNY Epstein investigation. She is coordinating with prosecutors to schedule a meeting.

persons.name: Johanna Rae Hudgens
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence, appears to be part of the legal team involved in the grand jury subpoena matter.

connections.description: Both are copied on legal correspondence regarding a grand jury subpoena, indicating they are working together on the same legal matter.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: Originally scheduled grand jury appearance date for an individual subpoenaed in the SDNY Epstein investigation, which was postponed.

events.title: Proposed Meeting with Prosecutors
events.description: Defense attorney Suzanne Jaffe Bloom proposed meeting with SDNY prosecutors to discuss her client's grand jury subpoena.

keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued on July 5, 2019, by the SDNY in connection with the Epstein investigation.
The scheduled grand jury appearance date of July 24, 2019, was postponed as part of ongoing discussions between defense counsel and prosecutors.
Multiple civil cases related to Jeffrey Epstein are referenced, including cases 15 Civ. 7433, 17 Civ. 616, and 08 Civ. 80736.
The email includes an attached standard proffer agreement, suggesting discussions about potential cooperation or information sharing.
